parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party.  It promotes a sustainability forum.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and aims to reach a wide audience interested in sustainability.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote a sustainability forum, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections. The content is focused on environmental issues and education.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post could be considered a form of public announcement or event promotion, similar to a news item about an upcoming conference. It does not advocate for or against any political candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions related to political candidates or parties.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>977833687717215</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes a sustainability forum ("Green Start-Up Sustainability Forum 2025").  It does not mention any political candidates, parties, or advocate for any particular political stance. The content focuses on environmental issues and education. The paid advertisement targets a broad audience interested in sustainability, not specifically voters in the parliamentary elections.  Therefore, it does not meet the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 and Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Green Start-Up</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
